headline.main: Google Reinstates European Links to Articles From The Guardian
headline.print_headline: Adapting to Privacy Ruling, Google Chooses to Hit ‘Undo’

headline.main: Microsoft to Lay Off Thousands, Most From Nokia Unit
headline.print_headline: Microsoft To Lay Off Thousands

docs.abstract: Microsoft announces that it will lay off up to 18,000 employees, many of them from company's troubled Nokia phone business, in an attempt at reinvigoration; cuts would be largest in company's history, and are the first major change by new chief executive Satya Nadella; Microsoft, while still profitable, has been consistently left behind as newer companies like Google and Facebook define the next generation of technology.
